biology_anatomy: Unicorns possess a single, spiraling horn known as an alicorn projecting from their forehead.
Unlike common horses, unicorns typically have cloven hooves similar to a goat.
The horn of a unicorn is spiraled in a helix pattern, which is unique in the animal kingdom.
Unicorn blood is a thick, silvery substance that glows faintly in the dark.
A unicorn's coat is said to be harder than diamonds, deflecting most conventional weapons.
The tail of a unicorn is often depicted as a lion's tuft rather than a horse's tail.
Unicorns have exceptionally keen senses, able to detect impurity or poison from miles away.
The alicorn (horn) has medicinal properties and can neutralize poisons instantly.
Unicorns are biologically immortal, immune to aging and natural disease.
Their eyes are typically deep blue or violet, lacking the lateral placement of prey animals.
A unicorn's mane and tail hair are incredibly strong and are often used in magical crafting.
Unicorns are extremely light-footed, leaving no tracks even in fresh snow.
Some anatomical descriptions include a 'beard' similar to a goat's on the unicorn's chin.
Unicorn tears are rumored to have petrification-reversing properties.
The gestation period of a unicorn is unknown, as they are rarely seen breeding.
A unicorn's heart rate is significantly slower than that of a horse, reflecting their calm nature.
Their bones are hollow like a bird's, aiding in their unnatural speed and agility.
The spiral of the horn always twists in a clockwise direction.
Unicorns have a unique digestive system that allows them to gain sustenance from moonlight.
The shimmer of a unicorn's coat is due to microscopic refractive scales on their hair.
behavior_habitat: Unicorns are elusive herbivores that graze on morning dew and enchanted flora.
A unicorn can purify an entire poisoned lake simply by dipping its horn into the water.
They are solitary creatures, rarely seen in groups larger than a mare and her foal.
Unicorns inhabit deep, ancient forests that have not been touched by human civilization.
They are fiercely territorial against evil creatures but gentle with other woodland animals.
A unicorn will fiercely defend itself using its horn like a lance if cornered.
Legends say unicorns are attracted to purity and will only approach a maiden.
Unicorns are most active during twilight and dawn, avoiding the harsh midday sun.
When threatened, a unicorn can teleport short distances, appearing as a flash of light.
Unicorns do not sleep in the traditional sense; they enter a meditative trance.
They communicate telepathically with each other and sometimes with pure-hearted humans.
A unicorn will starve itself to death if captured or placed in a cage.
They act as the protectors of their forest, driving away hunters and poachers.
Unicorns have a symbiotic relationship with fae creatures like pixies and dryads.
It is said that killing a unicorn curses the killer with a half-life, a cursed existence.
Unicorns migrate across dimensions rather than physical distances.
They are drawn to the sound of harps and soft, melodic singing.
A unicorn can run tirelessly for days without needing to stop for food or water.
They nurture the land they walk on; flowers bloom instantly in their footprints.
Unicorns are natural enemies of lions, and they often battle for dominance of the wild.
species_culture: The classical European unicorn is a white horse-like creature with a goat's beard.
The Qilin (or Kirin) is often referred to as the Chinese unicorn, having scales and antlers.
The Alicorn is a term often used for a winged unicorn, combining a pegasus and unicorn.
In Scotland, the unicorn is the national animal, symbolizing purity and strength.
The phrase 'The Lion and the Unicorn' refers to the heraldic supporters of the UK coat of arms.
The 'Hunt of the Unicorn' tapestries are famous medieval artworks depicting a unicorn hunt.
In Harry Potter lore, drinking unicorn blood keeps you alive but at a terrible price.
The biblical 'Re'em' is often translated as 'unicorn' in the King James Bible.
The Black Unicorn is a modern fantasy variant, often associated with night and terror.
Sea unicorns are a real-world reference to the Narwhal, which has a single tusk.
The constellation Monoceros is the Greek name for the unicorn.
Medieval bestiaries described the unicorn as a fierce beast that could defeat elephants.
Powdered alicorn was sold in apothecaries during the Renaissance as a cure-all.
The Invisible Pink Unicorn is a satirical deity used in religious debates.
In heraldry, the unicorn is always depicted in chains because it is too dangerous to roam free.
The Shadhavar is a Persian unicorn-like creature with a hollow horn that plays music.
The Karkadann is a fierce desert unicorn from Persian and Indian folklore.
Marco Polo famously mistook a rhinoceros for a unicorn, describing it as ugly.
The 'Dark Unicorn' is a trope where the creature is corrupted by evil magic.
In 'The Last Unicorn', the unicorn searches for the rest of her kind who were driven into the sea.
